title: Cassoulet (Quick Skillet)
description: A streamlined, weeknight-friendly take on classic French cassoulet: browned sausages and duck-style confit bits mingle with white beans, tomatoes, and aromatic herbs in a single skillet for a rich, comforting one-pan meal. Crisped top edges and a savory, herb-scented broth give the impression of the slow-cooked original in a fraction of the time.

ingredients.display_name: cannellini (white) beans, canned, drained and rinsed
mild pork sausages (e.g., Toulouse or Italian), halved lengthwise
duck confit or shredded cooked duck leg (can substitute extra sausage if unavailable)
ingredients.notes: optional; use shredded or chopped pieces
or use fire-roasted for extra flavor

ingredients.display_name: dry white wine or extra chicken broth

ingredients.notes: tied or left whole for easy removal
for crisp topping; can mix with butter
or use olive oil for dairy-free

ingredients.display_name: grated Parmesan or similar hard cheese (optional)
ingredients.notes: sprinkle into crumbs for extra savory note

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: drain and rinse beans, halve sausages lengthwise, chop bacon, dice onion, carrot and celery, mince garlic, and measure liquids and herbs.
Heat a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat and add oil. When shimmering, add sausages cut-side down and brown until well-colored, about 3–4 minutes per side; transfer to a plate.

In the same skillet, add chopped bacon and cook until fat renders and pieces are crisp, about 4 minutes, scraping up browned bits; remove some excess fat if skillet is very greasy, leaving a tablespoon.
Reduce heat to medium, add diced onion, carrot, and celery and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and translucent, about 5–6 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook 30–45 seconds until fragrant.

Stir in tomato paste and cook 1–2 minutes to caramelize slightly. Deglaze with white wine (if using) scraping the pan, then add diced tomatoes, beans, broth, thyme and bay leaf. Return sausages and any duck pieces to the skillet, nestling them into the beans.
Bring mixture to a gentle simmer, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook uncovered for 10 minutes to meld flavors and thicken the liquid slightly. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
While the cassoulet simmers, combine breadcrumbs with melted butter and optional grated cheese in a small bowl until evenly moistened.

Preheat broiler. Sprinkle breadcrumb mixture evenly over the top of the beans and sausages in the skillet. Place skillet under broiler until crumbs are golden and crisp, about 2–3 minutes—watch closely to prevent burning.
Remove skillet from heat, discard thyme sprigs and bay leaf, scatter chopped parsley and lemon zest over the top, let rest 3 minutes, then serve warm straight from the skillet.
